body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Kate F. Riley. Father of William H. Riley Served in Kentucky General Assembly for Bullitt County in 1835-1836 and for Nelson County in 1849-1850. Speaker of the House from 1849-1850. Whig elector in 1841. Practiced law in partnership with Peter B. Muir from 1849-1857. Louisville city council member from 1855-1857. Twelfth mayor of Louisville from 1858 to 1859. Practiced law in partnership with Samuel Russell and later with William H. Riley.

bibl.p: "Thomas W. Riley" in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 763.
